remarks: TODO-NM:  What shall be done with this OLD theorem?  Two ways to express single-valuedness of a class expression ` C ( y ) ` .  The converse does not hold.  Note that ` U. A = |^| A ` means ` A ` is a singleton ( ~ uniintsn ).  (Contributed by NM, 30-Oct-2010.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
reusv6OLD $p |- ( ( U. A =/= |^| A \/ B =/= (/) ) -> ( E! x e. A A. y e. B x = C -> E! x e. A E. y e. B x = C ) ) $.
